intro: Pelea pallida, commonly known as the pale pelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy texture. Pelea pallida is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
